result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas A Leverston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

05-02-2016/ Judge Frederick C Rosa
The Court ordered the JOC amended to reflect 334 days of sentence credit on counts one and two.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.

Letter from DOC requesting review of defendant's sentence credit.
Original Transcript (24 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing MARCH 18, 2016, received and filed.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 678
cf
Count one.
Count two.
/stipulation and order for return/destruction of exhibits, signed and filed.

Defendant Thomas A Leverston in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Thomas A Leverston in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Statements made as to sentencing.  Court reviews and receives photos submitted by the State (Exhibits 1-4) for purposes of sentencing.  Statement by victim, Johnny C.  Victim makes no claim for restitution.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 338 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION 3 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 months in the House of Correction (CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1). 

Court orders the following conditions of extended supervision:No 
- No contact with victim, Johnny C. 
- No weapons
- No new offenses
- No drug or alcohol usage
- Cooperate with any other terms and conditions deemed appropriate by agent
Court orders restitution set at $0.  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to both counts in the amended information.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  State requests sentencing hearing be adjourned to allow victim time to submit restitution information.  Court grants request.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas A Leverston in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Defendant Thomas A Leverston in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for jury trial today.  Matter is in resolution posture.   Filed, amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  

Court ordered COUNT 1 amended to Possession of a Firearm by a Felon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.29(2)(a), a Class G Felony.
Court ordered COUNT 2 amended to Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.20(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
State's Witness List, filed.

Attorney Craig S. Powell in court, defendant Thomas A Leverston not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court is in trial and defendant was not produced for today's hearing.  Court holds final pretrial with counsel in chambers off the record, matter continues on the record. Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 1/25/16 at 9:30am in br. 35.

Final pre-trial scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Craig S. Powell in court, defendant Thomas A Leverston not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is in trial posture.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Craig S. Powell in court, defendant Thomas A Leverston not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel was recently appointed and requests status date. Counsel does not wish to address bail today.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
- for reconsideration of bail, filed pro se.

Defendant Thomas A Leverston in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Defendant Thomas A Leverston in custody.   Hanna Kolberg for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court GRANTS motion, Attorney Washington is withdrawn as counsel of record forthwith. 9/9/15 jury trial date is removed from the calendar.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas A Leverston in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Thomas A Leverston in custody.  Ronald Dague for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Johnny C.; Leonie C. or their residence
